snippet: The fasting protest was the latest display of anger at the 23 California State University campuses, where the system has lost roughly $970 million in state financing since 2008.
abstract: Dozen students at California State University, Northridge, angry about tuition increases and cuts in courses and enrollment, declare a hunger strike; fasting protest is the latest display of anger at the 23 State University campuses, where the system has lost roughly $970 million in state financing since 2008.
lead_paragraph: The fasting protest was the latest display of anger at the 23 California State University campuses, where the system has lost roughly $970 million in state financing since 2008.

headline.seo: California State Students Plan to Fast in Protest Over Cuts
headline.main: At California State, Protesters Start a Fast
headline.print_headline: At California State, Protesters Start a Fast
